Try a new sport with the 'Turn Up and Play' sessions

By Henry Gee

Henry Gee attends a 'Turn Up and Play' Volleyball session for a new, supportive and volunteer lead fitness experience

James strike late to scrape past determined Wentworth

James and Wentworth produced a college football classic which had goals galore, a penalty, and some brilliant last ditch defending. Ultimately it was James who proved too strong for their opponents, snatching a late winner to extend their unbeaten start to the season.

Offord hat-trick sends York seconds into third round

The men's football seconds beat Easingwold Town 3-0 today to progress to the third round of the North Riding FA Challenge Cup, with James Offord scoring a hat-trick. (Thumbnail credit Hat-trick hero Offord, Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

Leeds Met fight back to take the points in men's rugby

A superb comeback from Leeds Metropolitan seconds earned them the points on 22 Acres today and ended York's unbeaten start to the season. A great start had seen the White Rose go 17-0 up but the visitors stormed back into the match and a late penalty from fly-half Ross McIntosh sealed a 20-17 victory.

Men's basketball seconds suffer defeat at the hands of Newcastle

York's men's basketball seconds suffered their second defeat of the season against Newcastle University. The visitors were strong from the start and York found themselves 0-9 down within the first five minutes.

Tale of two halves for York's netball firsts

A poor first half performance by York's netballers saw them well beaten by a strong Teesside team, the game finishing 47-37 to the visitors.

Women's basketball team beat city rivals in impressive display

York's women basketball team recorded a superb win against intercity rivals St John's. In an excellent performance York were strong from the start.

Women's volleyballers enjoy win over Sheffield

The result the performance deserved won out today, as York's women volleyball team comfortably outplayed their Sheffield counterparts in a straight sets victory. Although Sheffield played nicely in spells, they were far too inconsistent to offer York any real threat.

Doubles pairings make the difference as York draw with Hallam

The men's badminton firsts team were indebted to their doubles pairings as they picked up their first point of the season against Sheffield Hallam today. Despite losing all four singles matches, York twice came from behind to draw a pulsating match 4-4.

York Sport budget gets PS2,000 boost

THE UNIVERSITY is to provide a PS2,000 cash injection to York Sport so that they can train students to be coaches, in exchange for clubs going out into the local community.

Alcuin and Derwent find top gear to run in the tries during high-scoring day of rugby

Alcuin romped to a 41-0 win against an injury plagued Vanbrugh side as the College Rugby season got underway on Sunday. After a tight opening, Alcuin imposed themselves, a flurry of second half tries giving them a well earned bonus point. (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Agatha Torrance)

YUsnow members in Team GB

Two York students are representing Great Britain at Snowboardcross. Thomas Farrow and Marlies Neuner are competing in boarder cross competitions throughout Europe this season (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: YUsnow)

York student on international duty

University of York student Sean Carmody says it was a "great honour" to represent his country, after he earned a call-up to the Ireland Rugby League side (Thumbnail credit Photo Credit: Emerald Ruby)

The Mixer

It's been a long and fruitful year; a year of Roses victories, big claims about penalties, missed penalties, hours of podcasts, thousands of tweets and the blood sweat and tears of, what feels like, a million BUCS Wednesdays.

Monday Night Lights: Beazley-Long on American Sport

David Ambrozejczyk may have left York but Alex Beazley-Long has filled his considerable shoes to keep our blog on American Sport going strong (Thumbnail credit David Freese, third baseman for the St. Louis Cardinals. Image: Keith Allison via Flickr Creative Commons)

Clinical strike-duo give Vanbrugh first win

Strikers Elliot Rous-Ross and Adam Lewis shared four goals to lead Vanbrugh to a convincing 4-1 win over Alcuin

Farrell wins it for Derwent with last-minute winner

After losing to Halifax in the final of last year's College Cup, Derwent exacted revenge when substitute Jake Farrell dealt the decisive blow in an epic 4-3 battle. (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Goodricke delighted as James throw away three-goal lead

Goodricke managed to pull off an astonishing comeback, as they fought back from a three goal deficit against a strong James side.

Langwith and Wentworth share the spoils

Wentworth faced Langwith in the second College Football match of the season with the game ending in a 1-1 draw.

Men's volleyball firsts clinch late win against Manchester

In a nail-biting encounter, the men's volleyball firsts scraped together enough late-game momentum to win their fight against the Manchester firsts by three sets to one. (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

York rugby seconds crushed by relentless Durham

York's rugby seconds suffered a crushing defeat at the hands of Durham in their third game of the season.

Men's fencers foiled in the foil as Keele steal a win

York held their own in their first match of the season against Keele, until the final event of the foil where they were outclassed by a strong visitors' side. A good spirited match ended with a 135-98 loss for York. (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Men's badminton firsts on wrong end of heavy defeat

York men's badminton firsts team endured a second heavy defeat in a row, losing 7-1 to Manchester in the BUCS Northern Conference 1A. The thrashing came a week after an 8-0 defeat away at Leeds Met, in what has proved to be an extremely difficult start to the season. (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Scrapping relegation would kill English football

Boxing expert Graham Lilley switches sports, but keeps the gloves on, as he lambasts recent talk of relegation being scrapped in the Premier League. (Thumbnail credit Dave Whelan has threatened to pull Wigan out of the Premier League should proposed plans to scrap relegation go ahead. Image: illarterate via Flickr Creative Commons )

Hyde penalty enough for James to beat Halifax

A Jonny Hyde penalty did enough for James as they beat last year's College Cup champions Halifax 1-0. (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Classy Derwent ease past Alcuin in College Football kick-off

Derwent College kicked off their league campaign in fine style with a comfortable 2-0 victory over Alcuin (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Astbury proves the difference as Goodricke defeat Langwith

An early goal from Sam Astbury gave Goodricke a narrow win over Langwith in their first game of the season. In a tight encounter, it was Goodricke's cutting edge in attack that proved to be the difference between the sides, with Langwith unable to create many clear opportunities (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Three goals apiece as Wentworth and Vanbrugh share entertaining draw

Wentworth and Vanbrugh clashed in a thrilling opening encounter with the match finishing in a 3-3 draw. After a goalless first half both teams upped their game after the break to produce and incredible second half which included six goals. (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

Second half comeback helps men's rugby firsts overcome Lancaster

The men's rugby firsts fought back from being behind at half-time to overcome rivals Lancaster and continue their long-running dominance over the Red Rose.

Losing start for men's footballers as Durham prove too strong

In their first fixture of a new BUCS campaign, York men's football firsts lost out to their Durham counterparts by a single goal.

York women's hockey players hit four past Leeds thirds

York's women got off to a flying start in their league campaign as they defeated the University of Leeds thirds 4-1
